item.title: Android Memory Forensics
item.description: Objectives Learn Volatility Learn LiME Compile Android 10 Kernel Dump Memory on an Android Devices to see if data can be plucked from RAM using LiME Read dumped Memory using the Volatility Framework Setup LiME (https://github.com/504ensicsLabs/LiME) Android Kernel (https://source.android.com/setup/build/building-kernels) Volatility Framework (https://github.com/volatilityfoundation/volatility) Introduction The Plan

item.title: Helm3-secrets on KMS
item.description: Setup / Prerequisites A working Kubenetes (GKE) Helm3 KMS Permissions Sops (https://github.com/mozilla/sops/) Let’s Do it! Key Generation First off you need to create a user in IAM with permissions (KMS Admin), and setup gcloud with this user After this, create a key ring and keys with the following comands: gcloud kms keyrings create helm \ --location us-west1 gcloud kms keys create helm-secrets \ --location us-west1 \ --keyring helm \ --purpose "encryption" --rotation-period "90d" \ --next-rotation-time "2020-05-30T01:00:00" This will create a key ring named helm with a key called helm-secrets in us-west1 with a 90 day rotation period starting on May 30th 2020.

item.title: Who am I?
item.description: #Who Am I? I am a Chilean Software Engineer turned Devops Engineer, although I code by day I attempt to do security research in whatever peaks my interest, usually these days it is forensics and android, but I am hoping to shift gears to Kubernetes Security sometime in the future. This blog serves as my attempt to document whatever the hell I’m up to.
